lines.text: [Discussing satellite surveillance of the terrorist training camps in North Africa]

The people in those camps know probably better than we do exactly what time the satellite's going to pass overhead. And, Marty... unless you authorize us to retask those satellites so we can get a look before they're overhead from the side, we are never gonna know which camp they're at.
Jack, do you have any idea how big a deal it is to retask those satellites?

[gives him an "It has to be done" look]
Yeah!
Excuse me, Jack, tell me one thing in life that is absolutely for certain.
My daughter's love.
Ah, ye're not gonna make me wear a rubber, are ye? Ye know, the church says wearin' one o' them's a sin, darlin'.
So's this, darlin'!
[shoots Jimmy in the head while he lies in bed]
It was him wasn't it? He's never gonna leave us alone.
He'll never get that close to us again, honey. That's why he calls in the middle of the night. It's all he can do.
You get him, Jack. I don't care what you have to do. Just get him.
I saw his wife and daughter die, but she and Neddy blew it. Ryan's still alive.
They're not dead, Sean.
What?
They survived it. I can't say it any plainer than that. It doesn't matter. Your trip served its purpose.
It *does* matter!
How's the family, Ryan? Nearly lost 'em, didn't you? It's easy to get at them. You should look after your family better, you know? Are you there?
Yeah.
I understand your little girl's feeling better, eh? Lost her spleen though, eh? Pity, that. Make it a mighty tough on her to fight off infection, eh Jacky?
You sick son of a bitch!
[showing Marty some pictures of the woman they're after, provided by Paddy O'Neil]
Paddy O'Neil can sleep at night. In fact he probably enjoys the irony. She's not Irish; she's English.
[about Paddy O'Neil and the pictures he provided to Jack]
You tell O'Neil that you're looking for a girl, he gives you the pictures of a girl. He obliges you to get you off his back. And you believe him?
I didn't tell him I was looking for a girl, Marty.

Attention to orders. I have a presentation to make. For service above and beyond the call of duty of a tourist, or even a Marine, we recognize Professor John Patrick Ryan, with the Order of the Purple Target.
[he hangs a medal around Jack's neck in the shape of a bulls-eye, with the words "SHOOT ME" on it]
And hope that he will duck next time, lest he become part of history, rather than a teacher of it.

[to CIA Agent Geoffrey Watkins who turned out to be a mole, and has already been shot once]
Want me to start with the other knee?
[first lines]

[answering machine answers]
Sorry, we can't come to the phone right now. If you leave a message, we'll get back to you as soon as we can. Thanks.
Down! Get down!
Move in!
Get down!
[the car explodes]
Come! Get down! Keep her down!
They were moving him to Albany Prison in the Isle of Wight while it happened. We think he's left the country.

Marty, excuse me. Let's deal in what we know and not what we don't. We know he's escaped. We know it happened in Kent near the Channel. If he's left the country... Jack, listening? The chances he'd come here, that he'd try, that he could come here are so remote, I have trouble even saying it.
And yet your first instinct was to come all the way here and tell me.
There's laying about and laying low. There's a difference.
Is there?
So, you just waded on in like John Wayne. Why'd you do it? What were you thinking, man?
I don't know. I wasn't thinking.
That's it? You sound like some of my students.
It just pissed me off. I couldn't just stand there and watch him shoot those people right in front of me. It was... rage. Pure rage... Just made me mad.
Here's hoping you never get mad at me, man.

[to the attacker]
Where's Sean Miller? Where's Sean Miller?
What about my daughter?
Let's sit down for a moment.
No, talk to me.
It will be a while before we know. Maybe in the morning.
Where's Sally?
She's in the recovery room, honey. They're watching her. We'll know in seven or eight hours.
[Sobs]
They had to remove her spleen! She's in pretty bad shape.
I am telling you I want back in!

Listen! Who are we looking for here, huh? IRA terrorists or some ultra-violent faction of the IRA, fighting the cause their way? Jimmy O'Reardon checked into a hotel with a woman with long red hair. Long red hair! This is who we should be looking for! We find her... we'll find him.
Bring up Camp Eighteen again. Tighten on the camp here.
SAS could take out any one of these camps in under two minutes. Kill everybody there and be gone before the echo fades. Are you sure this is the same woman?
[Jack has a vacant look on his face]
Keep at it, then.
I'm not after your job, Marty. I'm after the man who tried to kill my family.
Where are you taking me, Marty?
It's you who have taken us, Jack...
Satellite now entering target area.
...Into battle.
Enlargement Sector Four. Airborne Support approaching target area. E.T.A. Thirty five seconds.
I want to know where Sean Miller and Kevin O'Donnell are.

[scoffs]
Let me try and understand this. You want me to sell out my fellow lrishmen to you? I don't think you understand me at all.
Oh, l think l do.
Listen! l don't give a damn what they've done. But the day l sell out my own people is the day l'll put a bullet through my head.
So, that's it then?
That's it. You know on second thought maybe I won't have a drink with you
Fine. I'll go home.
Have a nice trip.
I'll go home and call all the news stations! Invite them into my daughter's hospital ward. Give them what they want!

[Gets in O'Neil's face]
I don't give a shit whether you did it or not. But if you don't help me, I will put such a stranglehold on your gun money that your boys will be out in the streets throwing rocks! I will *fucking* destroy you! I will make it my mission in life!
Inspector Robert Highland, we meet at last. Tell me, what do they pay you to turn against your own people?
Get on with it and be on your way.
Very well, if that's the way you feel about it.
[Kevin hands his gun over to Sean, who then proceeds to kill Highland]
[Discussing Cathy Ryan's pregnancy]
I don't have any say in this, do I?
Sure, you do, honey. This is a family. Everybody's got a say.
But my say's after the fact.
[Thinks about this]
Or am I wrong?

[nervously]
Uhh... no, you're right.
Michaela really despises her little sister.
Yeah? Well, ready for this? It could be even worse. It could be a baby brother.

[rolls her eyes]
Oh, no! *Boys!*
[to Ryan]
Bloody proud of yourself, aren't you? You stuck your nose in where it didn't belong. And now you've killed my baby brother.
[regarding Sally Ryan, who they are about to kill]
Kinda cute, isn't she?
Is she?
[after Cathy and Sally crash into concrete divider on highway]

[satisfied and confident]
They're gone.
This won't be like anything you've ever done before, little brother.
Target leaving the palace now.
There's daddy!
Get out of the car! Come on! Get out! Open the fucking door! British!
Jack!
Open it or I'll blow it up!
[Jack shoots Paddy]
Paddy?

Fuck the bloody IRA. All these years of war, and they've got us nowhere. In its heart and soul, England is still a monarchy, and that is where we must strike... at the royals and the ruling class. You're either with us or against us, Jimmy Boy. Make up your mind.
We are unarmed.
But what Ryan done can't be undone. So you should stop thinking about it.
I can't.
When the IRA carry out any form of campaign, they admit to it. Common sense, logic...
That is a kill.
It's over.
Get me Hostage Rescue at Quantico now!
Let's do it.
[last lines]

[on the phone]
Okay, tell us... Thank you!

[to Sean Miller]
Although l disapprove of the things you've done, l can't quite bring myself to condemn you. l can't, because l understand where the hatred comes from. l more than understand it. But the fact is, we're very near the darkest hole in all of Great Britain.
Kevin. Charlie's gonna drop by tonight to try to straighten things out. Be smart. Talk to him. And hold your temper.
I promise. Thanks, Jimmy.
[Later, after O'Donnell kills three IRA hitmen who were sent to his house to kill him]
That's me holding my temper, Jimmy-boy.
